p.s: I am writing to you in response to the interview with Ayad Akhtar which has only recently been published in Guernica Magazine and I wanted to tell you about my opinion about faith being one's main identity marker, as Akhtar callcalls it.
After I read the book of the play Disgraced I at first thought Ayad Akhtar was right that one's main identity is defined by faith.
Which is shown by Akhtar in his play at the example of Amir.
Who'sWhose life is influenced by his Muslim heiratageheritage.
For example in his job where he hides his background so that he won't get associated with Muslims who everyone think are terrorists.
But in my opinion, a student growing up in Germany faith isn't as important as in the play Disgraced described.
For example I don't choose my friends based on religion but based on what interessesinterests they have or what football-club they are fans of or if they play the same sports as me.
These are the points which describesdescribe one's main identity in my point of view.
Maybe I sometimes meet new friends through church but they aren't my friends because we have the same religion but because we have some interessesinterests which are the same.
Maybe it is only the case in Germany because here are most people Christians or non believer and not like in the USA where a lot of different believesbeliefs come together at one place.
Then you have to find someone with whom you have the same interessesinterests which probably is most easily to find in someone who has the same religion as you.
ThatsThat's because it would mean you have one thing in common.
But now back to Amir.
In my opinion the believebelief of Ayad Akhtar that faith being one's main identity marker is represented in his book, where everything has to do something with religion.
For example at the celebrations party for EmilysEmily's art gallery all they do is talk about religion instead of the art gallery.

Another argument for faith being one's main identity marker is also brought by Amir at the celebration party for EmilysEmily's art gallery when he tells everyone that in Muslim countries the Quran is like the constitution in the USA.
When I read this I asked myself how do you want to identify yourself else when even your country is identified troughthrough faith.
But we can feel lucky that not in every country the country is identified through faith.
Since faith is something which has brought countless wars.
For example the Kreuzz√ºge where millions of people died in the name of a holy war.
Another negative point is that if everyone would be identified troughthrough faith we would have a lot more conflicts and discrimination today.
Since each religion would want to prove that they are right and everyone else wrong.
That is why I think faith is not one's main identity marker and that we should feel that this isn't the case.
